summary: In September 2017, two major hurricanes hit the U.S. Virgin Islands, causing billions of dollars in damage. In response, the Federal Emergency Management Agency provided more than $1.9 billion in grant funding to help repair damaged infrastructure, among other efforts. FEMA also expanded a pilot program that funded home repairs to allow survivors to shelter in their homes because other emergency shelters weren’t available. FEMA...
title: U.S. Virgin Islands Recovery: Additional Actions Could Strengthen FEMA's Key Disaster Recovery Efforts
